meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I dragged my heavy bag to school.
meanings.sent2: She dragged the chair across the room to reach the bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The cat dragged its toy mouse around the house, pretending to hunt.
meanings.sent4: His tired feet felt like they were being dragged through mud after the long hike.
meanings.sent5: The criminal dragged the stolen goods behind him as he fled the scene.

meanings.sent1: The kite flew high, dragged by the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The boat moved slowly as it was dragged by the powerful current.
meanings.sent3: The dog ran happily, dragging the leash behind him in the park.
meanings.sent4: The fallen branches were dragged away by the tractor after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The heavy suitcase was dragged noisily down the stairs.

meanings.sent1: The injured hiker dragged himself back to the campsite.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine sputtered as it dragged up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy child dragged his feet along the hallway to bed.
meanings.sent4: The tired snail dragged its shell across the garden path.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted marathon runner dragged his body to the finish line.
